title: Tobacco Box, mid-18th century
markings: Both the interior of the box and the lid are marked: "VIII"
provenance: M. Mathilde Mourraille; 1957: acquired by Museum
dimensions: H x W x D (closed): 3.5 x 12 x 7 cm (1 3/8 x 4 3/4 x 2 3/4 in.)
creditline: Gift of C. Gustave Mourraille in memory of his sister, M. Mathilde Mourraille
description: Oval box with hinged cover. Engraved lid with harbor scene and inscription.  In foreground, figure at shore greets two figures about to alight a smaller boat. In the near distance, a boat sits in harbor.  On the underside, farmyard scene and inscription. In the foreground towards right, a man stands near a well(?) surrounded by chickens and a horse or mule.  In the background, a woman stands near pair of pigs and a spindle(?).  Bordering both scenes and decorating the side of the box are engraved wave patterns.

tombstone.epitaph:
Tobacco Box, mid-18th century.
mid-18th century. Brass. Gift of C. Gustave Mourraille in memory of his sister, M. Mathilde Mourraille. 1957-121-4.
